text:
The basic problem of computer graphics stans with a scene and a viewing poSitIon. 
Ideally. the image on the screen is what the viewer would see. The simplest image 
assigns just one bit 10 every small picture element-called a pixel. It is light or dart. 
This gives a black and white picture with no shading. You wou ld not approve. In 
practice. we assign shading levels belween 0 and 28 for three colors like red, green.
